easy.Question: The line graph below shows the changes in the average daily temperature in London over a year in 2023. Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and make comparisons where relevant. Write at least 150 words.
easy.Diagram:
<svg width="600" height="350" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg">
  <rect x="0" y="0" width="600" height="350" fill="#f9f9f9"/>

  
  <line x1="50" y1="300" x2="550" y2="300" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text x="300" y="330" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="14" fill="#333">Month</text>

  
  <text x="50" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Jan</text>
  <text x="90" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Feb</text>
  <text x="130" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Mar</text>
  <text x="170" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Apr</text>
  <text x="210" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">May</text>
  <text x="250" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Jun</text>
  <text x="290" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Jul</text>
  <text x="330" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Aug</text>
  <text x="370" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Sep</text>
  <text x="410" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Oct</text>
  <text x="450" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Nov</text>
  <text x="490" y="315" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Dec</text>

  
  <line x1="50" y1="50" x2="50" y2="300" stroke="#333" stroke-width="2"/>
  <text transform="rotate(-90 20 175)" x="20" y="175" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="14" fill="#333">Temperature (°C)</text>

  
  <text x="40" y="300" text-anchor="end" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">0</text>
  <text x="40" y="250" text-anchor="end" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">5</text>
  <text x="40" y="200" text-anchor="end" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">10</text>
  <text x="40" y="150" text-anchor="end" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">15</text>
  <text x="40" y="100" text-anchor="end" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">20</text>
  <text x="40" y="50" text-anchor="end" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">25</text>

  
  <line x1="50" y1="250" x2="550" y2="250" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="2,2"/>
  <line x1="50" y1="200" x2="550" y2="200" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="2,2"/>
  <line x1="50" y1="150" x2="550" y2="150" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="2,2"/>
  <line x1="50" y1="100" x2="550" y2="100" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="2,2"/>
  <line x1="50" y1="50" x2="550" y2="50" stroke="#ccc" stroke-width="1" stroke-dasharray="2,2"/>

  
  
  <circle cx="50" cy="250" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>
  
  <circle cx="90" cy="240" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>
  
  <circle cx="130" cy="210" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>
  
  <circle cx="170" cy="180" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>
  
  <circle cx="210" cy="140" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>
  
  <circle cx="250" cy="110" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>
  
  <circle cx="290" cy="80" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>
  
  <circle cx="330" cy="90" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>
  
  <circle cx="370" cy="130" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>
  
  <circle cx="410" cy="170" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>
  
  <circle cx="450" cy="220" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>
  
  <circle cx="490" cy="240" r="3" fill="#ff5733"/>

  <polyline points="50,250 90,240 130,210 170,180 210,140 250,110 290,80 330,90 370,130 410,170 450,220 490,240" fill="none" stroke="#ff5733" stroke-width="3"/>

  
  <text x="300" y="30" text-anchor="middle" font-family="Arial" font-size="16" font-weight="bold" fill="#333">Average Daily Temperature in London (2023)</text>

  
  <rect x="450" y="60" width="15" height="15" fill="#ff5733"/>
  <text x="470" y="72" font-family="Arial" font-size="12" fill="#333">Temperature (°C)</text>

</svg>
easy.Sample answer:
The line graph illustrates the fluctuations in the average daily temperature in London over the course of 2023. Overall, there was a clear seasonal pattern, with temperatures steadily rising from the beginning of the year to a peak in mid-summer, followed by a gradual decline towards the end of the year. 

In January, the average daily temperature started at a relatively cool 5°C. This figure saw a slight increase to 6°C in February before rising more noticeably to 9°C in March. The upward trend continued into spring, with April recording 12°C and May reaching 16°C. The temperature climbed further, hitting 19°C in June and peaking at 22°C in July, which was the warmest month of the year.

Following the summer high, a downward trend began in August, with the temperature falling slightly to 21°C. This decline became more pronounced in September (17°C) and October (13°C). By November, the average temperature had dropped significantly to 8°C, and it concluded the year at 6°C in December, mirroring the temperature observed in February.

</svg>
hard.Sample answer:
The line graph illustrates the fluctuations in the average daily temperature in London over the course of 2023. Overall, there was a clear seasonal pattern, with temperatures steadily rising from the beginning of the year to a peak in mid-summer, followed by a gradual decline towards the end of the year. 

In January, the average daily temperature started at a relatively cool 5°C. This figure saw a slight increase to 6°C in February before rising more noticeably to 9°C in March. The upward trend continued into spring, with April recording 12°C and May reaching 16°C. The temperature climbed further, hitting 19°C in June and peaking at 22°C in July, which was the warmest month of the year.

Following the summer high, a downward trend began in August, with the temperature falling slightly to 21°C. This decline became more pronounced in September (17°C) and October (13°C). By November, the average temperature had dropped significantly to 8°C, and it concluded the year at 6°C in December, mirroring the temperature observed in February.
